Class ECAMoutputSubsections

java.lang.Object
ECAMoutputSubsections
public class ECAMoutputSubsections extends Object
Subsections of solutions' output from ECAMpostProcessing, trimmed to size for display

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ECAMoutputSubsections(ECAMpostProcessing inPost)
    Initializes manager class to the local version

  • Method Details

    • subsectionFactorLayers

      public int[][][] subsectionFactorLayers(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      This function transforms the output of a standard additive ECA calculation into the constituent binary factors of a solution from ECApathPermutations as layers
      Parameters:
      solution - a valid solution from ECAasMultiplications
      rows - number of rows to output
      columns - number of columns to output
      Returns:
      int array[layers][row][column] where each layer of a cell is that cell's neighborhood permuted with the permutation set

    • subsectionCoefficientMultiplication

      public double[][] subsectionCoefficientMultiplication(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      This function gets a subset of the output data calculated in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), non-negative real
      Parameters:
      solution - a solution from ECAMspecific
      rows - number of rows to output
      columns - number of columns to output
      Returns:
      coefficient field produced by the polynomial rather than the function itself

    • subsectionComplexVectorField

      public Complex[][][] subsectionComplexVectorField(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      Gets a rectangular subsection of the output from multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex vector, each unit vector is a column in the neighborhood after multiplication just before normalization
      Parameters:
      solution - ValidSolution used
      rows - number of rows to return
      columns - number of columns to return
      Returns:
      a rectangular subsection of the output from validSolutionCoefficientCalculations()

    • subsectionComplexField

      public Complex[][] subsectionComplexField(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      Gets a rectangular subsection of the output from multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), complex
      Parameters:
      solution - ValidSolution used
      rows - number of rows to return
      columns - number of columns to return
      Returns:
      a rectangular subsection of the output from validSolutionCoefficientCalculations()

    • subsectionVectorField

      public double[][][] subsectionVectorField(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      Returns a subsection of the vector field calculated in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), it is the neighborhood polynomial results just prior to the neighborhood normalization and just after the geometric mean
      Parameters:
      solution - a valid solution from ecam.specific
      rows - number of rows to return
      columns - number of columns to return
      Returns:
      double[numBits][rows][columns], each layer is the coefficient of that layer's unit vector, of dimension numBits

    • subsectionNeighborhoodFirst

      public Complex[][] subsectionNeighborhoodFirst(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      Returns a subsection of the vector field calculated in multiplicativeSolutionOutput(), it is the neighborhood polynomial results just prior to the neighborhood normalization and just after the geometric mean
      Parameters:
      solution - a valid solution from ecam.specific
      rows - number of rows to return
      columns - number of columns to return
      Returns:
      double[numBits][rows][columns], each layer is the coefficient of that layer's unit vector, of dimension numBits

    • subsectionComplexFieldToBinary

      public int[][][] subsectionComplexFieldToBinary(int rows, int columns)
      Takes the complex output of a solution, if the real and imaginary parts are negative, they become 1's in the output, if positive, 0. The 0 index layer is the real part and the 1 index layer is the imaginary part
      Parameters:
      rows - number of rows of subsection of complexField[rows][post.gridSize]
      columns - number of columns of subsection of complexField[rows][post.gridSize]
      Returns:
      two layer binary array with the sign values of the real and complex parts as 1s and 0s

    • subsectionComplexFieldToBinary

      public int[][][] subsectionComplexFieldToBinary(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      Takes the complex output of a solution, if the real and imaginary parts are negative, they become 1's in the output, if positive, 0. The 0 index layer is the real part and the 1 index layer is the imaginary part

      This function along with its display class, SwingBinaryShadow, are experimental, and show that the binary shadow of the algorithm is not the original Wolfram code

      Parameters:
      solution - a ValidSolution from ECAMspecific
      rows - number of rows of subsection of complexField[rows][post.gridSize]
      columns - number of columns of subsection of complexField[rows][post.gridSize]
      Returns:
      two layer binary array with the sign values of the real and complex parts as 1s and 0s

    • additiveNeighborhood

      public int[][] additiveNeighborhood(ValidSolution solution, int rows, int columns)
      Value of each cell's input neighborhood from the binary additive version of the Wolfram code's output. If the Wolfram code is [0,1,0,1,0,1,0,1], each cell's neighborhood will be one of {0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7}
      Parameters:
      solution - solution that's been applied
      rows - number of rows to output
      columns - number of columns to output
      Returns:
      2D array of each cell's neighborhood value
